name: strikebreaking
content:

the practice of continuing to work during a strike or taking the job of a worker who is involved in a strike: News broadcasts openly encouraged strikebreaking. The miner was branded a scab for strike breaking. See
strikebreaker
More examplesFewer examplesHe helped organise strike-breaking at the Polkemmet colliery.My men won't take kindly to strike-breaking.

continuing to work during a strike, or taking the job of a worker who is involved in a strike: The government held secret meetings with the wives of strikebreaking miners. Union bosses have vowed to support any industrial action by making it hard for strike-breaking volunteer staff to work in airports. See
strikebreaker
More examplesFewer examplesThe Prime Minister even handed out medals to strike-breaking dairy farmers. He used strike-breaking ferry crews to break a blockade of the Channel ports.Non-union labourers were transported to the town in an attempt to provide a strike-breaking workforce.
